section.title: Bilge pumping system
section.para: The vessel is equipped with two electrically operated bilge pumps, one in the engine compartment and another in the main compartment. Each pump is connected to a float switch which can operate the pump automatically when water is detected in the bilge. Each float switch is backed-up by an independent water level sensor connected to the ship's alarm system.

section.title: Bilge system controls
section.para: Each bilge system is operated by a three-position switch located at the helm (labelled E.ROOM and M.COMP):

listitem.para: The bilge pump and float switch are switched off. In normal use the switch should never be left in this position unless the vessel is out of the water or the bilge system is being serviced. The bilge pump alarm indicator light will illuminate.

The bilge pump and float switch are enabled in automatic mode. If the float switch detects water in the bilge the pump will start automatically, the helm alarm siren and indicator will signal an alert and the bilge pump alarm indicator will illuminate.
The bilge pump will run, the helm alarm siren and indicator will signal an alert and the bilge pump alarm indicator will illuminate.

section.title: Bilge system alarms
section.para: Each bilge system has an indicator light at the helm which illuminates when (i) the bilge system is switched off and (ii) when the bilge pump is running. The indicator will flash when the bilge backup sensor detects water: typically this means that the float switch has failed to activate the bilge pump or the compartment is being inundated at a rate beyond the capacity of the bilge pump.

The helm alarm system will activate when a bilge pump is running for whatever reason and also when a backup sensor detects water. The audible component of the alarm can be cancelled, but the visual component will remain active until the condition causing the alert is corrected.
